msContents.summary: Devotional text attributed to the Padmapurāṇa, praising 108 names of the Hindu deity Rāma. Outlines the various heroic deeds of Rāma, especially the slaying of Hindu demons such as Rāvaṇa. Presented as a discourse between the legendary figures Nārada and Bhīṣma.

msItem.title: Rāmāṣṭottaraśatanāma
रामाष्टोत्तरशतनाम
msItem.colophon: Colophon: iti śrī padmapurāṇe nāradabhīṣmasaṃvāde śrī rāmāṣṭottaraśataṃ nāmasaṃpūrṇam astu // śrī sītārāmaca[ṃ]drārpaṇam astu // śubhaṃ bhavatu // idaṃ śake 1770 siddhārthīnāmasavatsare dakṣiṇāyane grīṣma ṛtaujyeṣṭhasitapakṣe saptamyāṃ guruvāsare sārdhayāmenhi likhitaṃ svārthaṃ parārthaṃ // ca // rāmāya rāmabhadrāya rāmacaṃdrāya vedhaseraghunāthāya nāthāya sītāyāḥ pataye namaḥ // (f. 2v).
